intro: Rumex pulcher subsp. divaricatus, commonly known as the slender dock, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and can be found in meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges. The plant features alternate, lanceolate leaves with a prominent midrib and a smooth, waxy surface. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and arranged in dense, terminal clusters. The species is notable for its ability to thrive in wet environments and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
